statement:
Theorem (Prohorov inequality, 1959):

Let $\{X_{i}\}_{i=1}^{n}$ be a collection of independent random
variables satisfying the conditions:

a\) $E[X_{i}^{2}]<\infty $ $\forall i$, so that one can write
$\sum_{i=1}^{n}E[X_{i}^{2}]=v^{2}$\
b) $\Pr\left\{\left\vert X_{i}\right\vert \leq M\right\} =1$
 $\forall i$.

Then, for any $\varepsilon \geq 0$, $$\begin{aligned}
\Pr\left\{ \sum_{i=1}^{n}\left( X_{i}-E[X_{i}]\right) >\varepsilon \right\}
&\leq &\exp \left[ -\frac{\varepsilon }{2M}\operatorname{arsinh}\left( \frac{\varepsilon
M}{2v^{2}}\right) \right] \\
\Pr\left\{ \left\vert \sum_{i=1}^{n}\left( X_{i}-E[X_{i}]\right) \right\vert
>\varepsilon \right\} &\leq &2\exp \left[ -\frac{\varepsilon }{2M}\operatorname{arsinh}\left( \frac{\varepsilon M}{2v^{2}}\right) \right]\end{aligned}$$

(See for the meaning of $\operatorname{arsinh}(x)$)
